Posts.Content: Collegekid wrote: So a little back story: I'm 20 years old with a lot of medical issues (some still un-diagnosed) and no health insurance. A few months ago I noticed changes in both of my breasts (firmer, really really sore and sensitive, but I also noticed a lump on the left side). I chalked it up to being on a new birth control, and didn't worry about it. A few nights ago I noticed my left breast had changed shape significantly (it's normally rounded, but now had a flattened side). I called my doctor the next day. they worked me in earlier today, and the midwife felt around, said she felt a lump and that I needed to get it checked. So now I'm planning on making an appointment tomorrow, but with no insurance I have no idea how long I will have to wait to get in at reduced rates. I know bc is rare in younger people, but I've NEVER had my breasts change shape like this before. Anyway, I'm mostly looking for people to confide in since most people my age haven't experienced things like this. Thanks, Jenna :) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Calling to schedule a mammogram in the AM. Collegekid Collegekid

Posts.Content: Jun 30, 2015 05:59PM Collegekid wrote: So the doctor who looked at the mammogram and ultrasound said it was a lymph node. I didn't know lymph nodes in the breast could randomly swell? I'm going back to my normal doctor soon. Hopefully they can explain it better.
